channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Candy is dandy but trick or treat for UNICEF has heft. And this year it turns 75!
item.description: The idea of asking kids to collect coins for needy children abroad was born of one couple's desire to add meaning to Halloweening. Some say it's now more important than ever.
item.content:encoded:
The idea of asking kids to collect coins for needy children abroad was born of one couple's desire to add meaning to Halloweening. Some say it's now more important than ever.

(Image credit: UNICEF USA)
item.dc:creator: Ari Daniel

item.title: Trump lowers China's tariffs. And, what to know for Casey Means' confirmation hearing
item.description: President Trump met with China's President Xi Jinping to address trade tensions. And, Trump's Surgeon General nominee, Dr. Casey Means, faces questions today in her Senate confirmation hearing.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump met with China's President Xi Jinping to address trade tensions. And, Trump's Surgeon General nominee, Dr. Casey Means, faces questions today in her Senate confirmation hearing.

(Image credit: Andrew Harnik)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: Trump rates meeting with China's Xi 12 out of 10, lowers tariffs
item.description: President Trump said he and Chinese leader Xi Jinping "agreed to almost everything" in their nearly two-hour meeting in South Korea, which Trump said was "friendly."
item.content:encoded:
President Trump said he and Chinese leader Xi Jinping "agreed to almost everything" in their nearly two-hour meeting in South Korea, which Trump said was "friendly."

(Image credit: Mark Schiefelbein)
item.dc:creator: Deepa Shivaram

item.title: Trump suggests the U.S. will resume testing nuclear weapons
item.description: President Donald Trump appeared to suggest the U.S. will resume testing nuclear weapons for the first time in three decades, saying it would be on an "equal basis" with Russia and China.
item.content:encoded:
President Donald Trump appeared to suggest the U.S. will resume testing nuclear weapons for the first time in three decades, saying it would be on an "equal basis" with Russia and China.

(Image credit: Mark Schiefelbein)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Why car insurance costs have soared (and what drivers are doing about it)
item.description: Car insurance premiums have increased at twice the rate of overall inflation. They've stabilized, at least for now, but more than half of Americans say the costs are painful.
item.content:encoded:
Car insurance premiums have increased at twice the rate of overall inflation. They've stabilized, at least for now, but more than half of Americans say the costs are painful.

(Image credit: Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Camila Domonoske

item.title: Trump keeps flirting with the idea of a third term. That would be unconstitutional
item.description: A recent interview with Steve Bannon reignited chatter about whether President Trump would try to run in 2028, despite the 22nd Amendment.
item.content:encoded:
A recent interview with Steve Bannon reignited chatter about whether President Trump would try to run in 2028, despite the 22nd Amendment.

(Image credit: Andrew Harnik)
item.dc:creator: Tamara Keith

item.title: What to watch for during Casey Means' confirmation hearing for surgeon general
item.description: While she completed medical school, she never finished residency, and is likely to face tough questions from senators about her qualifications and views on vaccines.
item.content:encoded:
While she completed medical school, she never finished residency, and is likely to face tough questions from senators about her qualifications and views on vaccines.

(Image credit: Ben Curtis)
item.dc:creator: Will Stone

item.title: Toronto Blue Jays take a 3-2 lead over Los Angeles Dodgers in World Series
item.description: Trey Yesavage set a World Series rookie record with 12 strikeouts in a 6-1 victory over the Los Angeles Dodgers that moved them within one win of their first championship since 1993.
item.content:encoded:
Trey Yesavage set a World Series rookie record with 12 strikeouts in a 6-1 victory over the Los Angeles Dodgers that moved them within one win of their first championship since 1993.

(Image credit: Brynn Anderson)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Nigerian Nobel winner Wole Soyinka says U.S. revoked his visa after Trump criticism
item.description: Soyinka, the first African to win the Nobel Prize in literature, believes his non-resident visa could have been rejected because he likened President Trump to a former Ugandan dictator.
item.content:encoded:
Soyinka, the first African to win the Nobel Prize in literature, believes his non-resident visa could have been rejected because he likened President Trump to a former Ugandan dictator.

(Image credit: Sunday Alamba)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: The East Wing gave women space to thrive in the White House — here's why
item.description: First intended as an entrance for social events, the East Wing became the first lady's office space. Historians say the shift was a key part of professionalizing staff for the president's wife.
item.content:encoded:
First intended as an entrance for social events, the East Wing became the first lady's office space. Historians say the shift was a key part of professionalizing staff for the president's wife.

(Image credit: Brendan Smialowski/AFP)
item.dc:creator: Kaity Kline
